Posts.Content: Hi Caz I hope your appointment goes well tomorrow and you get the answers and treatment plan you want. I get my Onco score tomorrow from the Oncologist - face to face (did try and get the result over the phone but no luck) and still not sure what I will do if I get the grey area result, like you have been reading everything but at the end of the day I guess we need the advice of the Oncologist into account as well as the result, Good luck for tomorrow. x
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: I find out an hour after you so nervous don't think I'll get much sleep tonight. x
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: So pleased for you caz great easily for you.  I wasn’t so fortunate my score was 35 so start FEC-T chemo on Tuesday and now I need rads following that. I am grateful for the rest though as I clearly need the chemo. So let battle commence.
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Sorry predictive text should read results not easily
Posts.Title: Intermediate Onco result, chemo yes or no?

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear your news Mavi and I completely get where you are coming from with the emotional side of things - it really took me by surprise like it was happening to someone else,  Since diagnosis every other advert and TV show seems to mention cancer - never really noticed before my diagnosis, The speed things move at has also taken me back as well.  Apart from immediate family I told a couple of very close friends as soon as I was diagnosed and they have been amazing but its completely up to you how and who you tell but their support will help you through this, Sending you a big virtual hug.
Posts.Title: New to site and recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow Mavi - im pretty rubbish at accepting help as well. I’ve just had to ask my mum to leave as I wanted some time on my own for a bit (she seems to think she needs to be here 24/7 so I’ve just explained I need some me time it probably sounded ungrateful but I am off to the hospital in a little while hopefully they can take out my drain and the results will be in for my next steps.
Posts.Title: New to site and recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hi Chez, Not so great news but I am pleased I had the test as I 100% know I need the chemo my Onco score was 35. Was also told they will do radiotherapy on my lymph nodes when chemo is finished - so start chemo Tuesday - have been an emotional wreck for the last 24 hours but got my head around it now . x
Posts.Title: Oncotype result

Posts.Content: So pleased for you I am still sitting in the waiting room - next in for my results.
Posts.Title: Oncotype result

Posts.Content: Aww Batfink Massive hugs It’s ok not to be the life and sole of you need you time
Posts.Title: New year, feeling blue

Posts.Content: So I got the results from my SNB and mastectomy and 1 node was cancerous, the other clear so I have been given the option of full node clearance or straight to chemo. Swaying towards straight to chemo  at the moment though I know I need to take a little more time to decide but looking likely I will start chemo in January,
Posts.Title: Chemo starts in the New Year

Posts.Content: Hi Canterbury- I was offered the lymph node clearance but after weighing up the information I don’t think it’s a path I want to take and the consultant is happy for me to go straight to chemo as I have An exiting medical condition meaning surgery gets complicated. Radiotherapy is not an option as I have has a mastectomy with clear margins so they won’t offer this for me so chemo seems to be the next step for me - so now waiting for oncology.  Gutted it’s shown up in the lymph node
Posts.Title: Chemo starts in the New Year
